sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 36 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C36, the alternating group A4 × C3, or one of the nine non-abelian groups of order 36.
message_1: What are the possible number of non-isomorphic groups of order 36 and can you identify all of them?
message_2:
There are four non-isomorphic groups of order 36. We can identify them as follows:

1. Cyclic group: C_36
This is the group of integers modulo 36 under addition. It is generated by a single element of order 36.

2. Direct product of two cyclic groups: C_9 × C_4
This group is formed by taking the direct product of a cyclic group of order 9 and a cyclic group of order 4. It has elements of the form (a, b), where a is an element of C_9 and b is an element of C_4.

3. Direct product of two cyclic groups: C_3 × C_12
This group is formed by taking the direct product of a cyclic group of order 3 and a cyclic group of order 12. It has elements of the form (a, b), where a is an element of C_3 and b is an element of C_12.

4. Semi-direct product of two cyclic groups: C_9 ⋊ C_4
This group is formed by taking the semi-direct product of a cyclic group of order 9 and a cyclic group of order 4. It is a non-abelian group, meaning that the group operation is not commutative.

These are the four non-isomorphic groups of order 36.
